columns.name: verified_access_endpoint_id
columns.description: The ID of the AWS verified access endpoint.

columns.name: verified_access_group_id
columns.description: The ID of the AWS verified access group.

columns.name: verified_access_instance_id
columns.description: The ID of the AWS verified access instance.

columns.name: status_code
columns.description: The endpoint status code. Possible values are pending, active, updating, deleting or deleted.

columns.name: application_domain
columns.description: The DNS name for users to reach your application.

columns.name: attachment_type
columns.description: The type of attachment used to provide connectivity between the AWS verified access endpoint and the application.

columns.name: description
columns.description: A description for the AWS verified access endpoint.

columns.name: device_validation_domain
columns.description: Returned if endpoint has a device trust provider attached.

columns.name: domain_certificate_arn
columns.description: The ARN of a public TLS/SSL certificate imported into or created with ACM.

columns.name: endpoint_domain
columns.description: A DNS name that is generated for the endpoint..

columns.name: endpoint_type
columns.description: The type of AWS verified access endpoint. Incoming application requests will be sent to an IP address, load balancer or a network interface depending on the endpoint type specified. Possible values are load-balancer or network-interface.

columns.name: load_balancer_options
columns.description: The load balancer details if creating the AWS verified access endpoint as load-balancertype.

columns.name: network_interface_options
columns.description: The options for network-interface type endpoint.
